intro: Phtheirospermum japonicum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered Japanese phtheirospermum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
